abstract.p: WebSwap.com, aiming to mimic deals available at yard sales, where prices tend to decline as the afternoon wears on, introduces new 'Garage Sale' service through which prices of goods for sale decline over time; sellers set starting and minimum prices for item, and service automatically decreases price by set amount every hour over course of seven days, or until someone swaps up whatever is being offered for sale; site also offers regular listing service where sellers can post item for sale at set price, without charge for 30 days or, for a 25-cent fee, for 90 days (S)

block.p: Aiming to mimic the deals available at yard sales, where prices tend to decline as the afternoon wears on, the online trading site WebSwap.com introduced a new ''Garage Sale'' service yesterday through which prices of goods for sale decline over time. Sellers set starting and minimum prices for an item, and the service automatically decreases the price by a set amount every hour over the course of seven days -- or until someone snaps up whatever is being offered for sale. WebSwap.com also offers a regular listing service where sellers can post an item for sale at a set price, without charge for 30 days or, for a 25-cent fee, for 90 days.
